definition: to scratch/to mess about with/to quarrel/to scramble to do/sb or sth that one can rely on
to grab/to catch/to arrest/to snatch/to scratch

sentences.english: Look for scratching or fiddling with clothing.
sentences.chinese: 關注抓撓或撥弄衣服的動作。

sentences.english: But their response was dampened, or inhibited, when the researchers subsequently scratched the itchy skin.
sentences.chinese: 當研究者隨後抓撓皮膚時，它們的反應呈抑制狀。

sentences.english: Scratching can actually trigger eczematous rashes.
sentences.chinese: 抓撓事實上可以引起溼疹性的皮疹。

sentences.english: Scratching an ordinary itch usually does no harm.
sentences.chinese: 抓撓普通騷癢通常無害。

sentences.english: But chronic itching may respond to scratching only very temporarily or not at all.
sentences.chinese: 但抓撓對慢性騷癢症只能暫時止癢，或者根本沒用。

sentences.english: Scratching by itself—that is, in the absence of an itch—had no such effect.
sentences.chinese: 而在不存在騷癢的情況下，抓撓本身並無這樣的作用。

sentences.english: I hitched up my nightgown and raked my nails across a line of mosquito bites on my leg.
sentences.chinese: 我提起睡裙，抓撓蚊子在腿上咬出的一溜兒包。

sentences.english: Every dog and cat knows that scratching relieves an itch.
sentences.chinese: 貓貓狗狗都知道抓撓可以止癢。

sentences.english: Cheese grater - To slide down a slab while scraping the knees, hands, and face.
sentences.chinese: 在抓撓膝蓋，手或者臉的時候滑倒。

sentences.english: Instead of scratching that insect bite, apply a drop or two of peppermint oil.
sentences.chinese: 不要抓撓昆蟲叮咬處，而是用一兩滴薄荷油。

sentences.english: She's tormented by their scratching at night.
sentences.chinese: 她晚上被它們的抓撓聲折磨得要命。

sentences.english: The bird's talons stopped in mid-furrow.
sentences.chinese: 鳥兒的爪子停止了抓撓。

sentences.english: "My daughter was having nervous breakdowns, she was scratching herself on her face and thighs, " she said.
sentences.chinese: 我女兒開始神經失常，不停地抓撓臉部和大腿。

sentences.english: I began to itch and desperately wanted to scratch.
sentences.chinese: 我開始覺得癢癢，非常想抓撓。
